briefTitle: Comparison of Two Needle Aspiration Techniques for Endoscopic Ultrasound-guided Fine Needle Aspiration (EUS-FNA) in Solid Pancreatic Lesions

armGroups.label: Capillary suction
interventionNames: Device: Capillary suction technique for EUS FNA

interventions.name: Capillary suction technique for EUS FNA

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

\- In-patients and out-patients between the age of 18years and 90 years with pancreatic masses presenting for EUS-FNA

Exclusion Criteria:

* Uncorrectable coagulopathy (INR \> 1.5)
* Uncorrectable thrombocytopenia (platelet \< 50,000)
* Uncooperative patients
* Pregnant women (women of childbearing age will undergo urine pregnancy testing, which is routine for all endoscopic procedures)
* Refusal to consent form
* Cystic lesions
* Inaccessible lesions to EUS

outcomeMeasures.title: Diagnostic Yield of Capillary Technique
outcomeMeasures.description: Diagnostic yield is defined as percentage of specimens in which diagnostic material is obtained.

outcomeMeasures.title: Diagnostic Yield of Standard Technique
outcomeMeasures.description: Diagnostic yield is defined as percentage of specimens in which diagnostic material is obtained.

outcomeMeasures.title: Sensitivity of EUS-FNA With Capillary Technique
outcomeMeasures.description: Sensitivity of the EUS-FNA with Capillary technique

outcomeMeasures.title: Sensitivity of EUS-FNA With StandardTechnique
outcomeMeasures.description: Sensitivity of the EUS-FNA with Capillary technique

outcomeMeasures.title: Sensitivity of EUS-FNA
outcomeMeasures.description: Comparison of EUS-FNA sensitivity using Capillary technique versus Standard technique for pancreatic solid lesions

outcomeMeasures.title: First Pass Diagnostic Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: The rate of aquiring diagnostic pancreatic mass tissue with first FNA pass

outcomeMeasures.title: Acquisition of Core Tissue
outcomeMeasures.description: The rate of acquiring core tissue of the pancreatic mass through EUS-FNA

outcomeMeasures.title: Diagnostic Accuracy of EUS-FNA
outcomeMeasures.description: The proportion of subjects without the disease with negative EUS-FNA in total of subjects without the disease
